SEARCH

Class Security

java.lang.Object
Security
public class Security extends Object
Provides security features including hashing data, validating account numbers and PINs, managing PIN attempt counts, and handling two-factor authentication (2FA) via email.

This class includes both static and instance methods. Static methods offer utilities such as hashing data with SHA-256, validating account numbers and PIN formats, and managing PIN attempt counts. Instance methods focus on two-factor authentication, including sending a 2FA code to a user's email, verifying the 2FA code, and managing 2FA attempts.

Usage involves creating an instance of the Security class, setting the user's email, and then invoking methods to perform 2FA or to use the static utility methods as needed.

  • Constructor Details

    • Security

      public Security()
      Constructs a new Security instance with a default, empty user email. The user email can be updated later using the setter method.

  • Method Details

    • hashDataWithSHA256

      public static String hashDataWithSHA256(String data)
      Hashes the given data using the SHA-256 algorithm.
      Parameters:
      data - The string data to be hashed.
      Returns:
      A hexadecimal string representation of the hashed data.
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if the SHA-256 algorithm is not available or if the character encoding is unsupported.

    • validateAccountNumber

      public static boolean validateAccountNumber(String accountNumber)
      Validates the format of an account number. The expected format is "1234-5678-9999".
      Parameters:
      accountNumber - The account number string to validate.
      Returns:
      true if the account number matches the expected format, false otherwise.

    • validatePIN

      public static boolean validatePIN(String pin)
      Validates the format of a PIN. The expected format is a 6-digit number.
      Parameters:
      pin - The PIN string to validate.
      Returns:
      true if the PIN matches the expected format, false otherwise.

    • incrementAndCheckPinAttempt

      public static boolean incrementAndCheckPinAttempt(String username)
      Increments the PIN attempt count for a given username and checks if the account should be locked based on the maximum number of allowed attempts.
      Parameters:
      username - The username for which the PIN attempt count is to be incremented.
      Returns:
      true if the number of attempts has reached the maximum limit, false otherwise.

    • resetPinAttempt

      public static void resetPinAttempt(String username)
      Resets the PIN attempt counter for a specific user.
      Parameters:
      username - The username for whom the PIN attempt count is to be reset.

    • performTwoFactorAuthentication

      public String performTwoFactorAuthentication()
      Simulates two-factor authentication (2FA) by sending a verification code to the user's email address.
      Returns:
      The verification code sent to the user, or null if the user's email is not provided.
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if there is an error sending the email.

    • verifyTwoFactorAuthentication

      public boolean verifyTwoFactorAuthentication(String inputCode)
      Verifies the input 2FA code against the generated verification code.
      Parameters:
      inputCode - The 2FA code provided by the user.
      Returns:
      true if the input code matches the generated code and the attempt is within the allowed limit, false otherwise.

    • getAttempts

      public int getAttempts()
      Retrieves the current number of 2FA code attempts.
      Returns:
      The number of 2FA code attempts.

    • getIs2FASuccessful

      public boolean getIs2FASuccessful()
      Checks if the two-factor authentication was successful.
      Returns:
      true if 2FA was successful, false otherwise.

    • getUserEmail

      public String getUserEmail()
      Gets the user's email address.
      Returns:
      The email address of the user.

    • setUserEmail

      public void setUserEmail(String userEmail)
      Sets the user's email address.
      Parameters:
      userEmail - The email address to be set for the user.

    • updateIsLockedStatusToCSV

      public static void updateIsLockedStatusToCSV(String filePath, String username, boolean isLocked)
      Updates the lock status of a user in a CSV file. If locking, it adds a timestamp; if unlocking, it clears the lock timestamp.
      Parameters:
      filePath - The path to the CSV file containing user data.
      username - The username of the account to update.
      isLocked - The lock status to set for the user.
